intro: Andrachne cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale pink to white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Andrachne cavaleriei is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
